articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Lao Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Lao Delegation
Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with a delegation of the Lao Ministry of Public Security led by Minister of Public Security Thongbanh Seng A Phone, secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.
					 The head of the delegation said that during his stay in the DPRK he saw for himself the army and people of the DPRK registering big achievements in various fields rallied close around General Secretary Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the 65th birthday of the DPRK and the conference of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Guatemalan President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Guatemalan President
Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Alvaro Colom, President of Guatemala, Wednesday on the occasion of the 189th anniversary of its independence.
					Kim in the message expressed belief that the bilateral ties of friendship would grow stronger in the future and sincerely wished the President of Guatemala success in his work for the prosperity of the country and well-being of its people.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Nicaraguan President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Nicaraguan President
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Daniel Ortega Saavedra, President of Nicaragua, on the occasion of the 189th anniversary of its independence.
					 Kim in the message expressed belief that the ties of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger, wishing the President greater success in his work for the country's prosperity.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets Austrian Delegation
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Austrian Delegation
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a friendly talk with the delegation of the Austrian Social Democratic Party's Sankt Poelten City Committee led by Chairman Anton Heinzl who is member of the Federal Leadership of the party, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.
					 The head of the delegation said that he got deep impression while visiting various places during his stay in the DPRK.
					
					 He came to know well about the fact that the reality of the DPRK is quite different from what is propagandized by the West, he noted, expressing will to make a positive contribution to developing the relations between the two countries and the two parties in the future.

articles.title: Gift from Austrian Delegation
articles.content:
Gift from Austrian Delegation
Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the visiting delegation of the Austrian Social Democratic Party's Sankt Poelten City Committee.
					 The gift was handed to Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, by Anton Heinzl, member of the Federal Leadership of the party and chairman of the committee who is leading the delegation, on Wednesday.

articles.title: Kim Ki Nam Meets Vishwanath
articles.content:
Kim Ki Nam Meets Vishwanath
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a talk with Vishwanath, director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea and secretary general of the International Kim Il Sung Prize Council, on Wednesday. 
					 Vishwanath said that he would always remember the honor of being received by President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il in the past. 
					
					 The Korean people have registered great achievements despite the imperialists' moves to stifle them, he pointed out. 
					
					 Noting that the Juche idea, great guiding idea in the era of independence, will be immortal, he expressed his will to more actively conduct the study and dissemination of the Juche idea.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Greets Guatemalan FM
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Greets Guatemalan FM
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Haroldo Rodas Melgar, foreign minister of Guatemala, on the occasion of the 189th anniversary of its independence. 
					 The message expressed belief that the relations between the two countries would grow stronger, wishing him success in his work.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chu Greets Nicaraguan FM
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chu Greets Nicaraguan FM
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Wednesday sent a message of greetings to his Nicaraguan counterpart Samuel Santos Lopez on the 189th independence day of Nicaragua.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in various fields, wishing the minister success in his work.

articles.title: DPRK Order Awarded to Kanji Inoki
articles.content:
DPRK Order Awarded to Kanji Inoki
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- The Order of DPRK Friendship 1st Class was awarded to Kanji Inoki, president of the Inoki Genom Joint Co., Ltd. of Japan.
					 Kanji Inoki did many things for the friendship between the two peoples of the DPRK and Japan.
					
					 A ceremony of awarding the order took place at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.
					
					 Present there were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Pak Kun Gwang, chairman of the DPRK-Japan Friendship Association, officials concerned and the party of the president of the Inoki Genom Joint Co., Ltd. of Japan on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: Typhoon No. 7 Claims Casualties
articles.content:
Typhoon No. 7 Claims Casualties
Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Most areas of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea have suffered a serious damage due to Typhoon No. 7 in early September.
					 According to information available in a relevant organ, scores of people lost their lives in the country, struck by torrential rains, rainstorms and landslides.
					
					 More than 3,300 dwelling blocks were collapsed so that some 8,380 families lost their properties and live in makeshift shelters.
					
					An estimated 30,550 hectares of standing crops were flooded, buried or washed away.
					
					 Some 230 public and production-related buildings and more than 170 sections of roads were damaged.
					
					 Meanwhile, 6,200 square meters of roadbed were totally wrecked in 250-meter-long sections of railroad and 65,980 meters of railroad ruined by landslides.
					
					 Power-transmission lines were broken and reservoirs and waterworks destroyed in some areas.
					
					 Electricity and water supply and traffic have been cut off in affected areas and their residents lack food and medicines.

articles.title: 7th Pyongyang Int'l Science and Technology Book Fair Closes
articles.content:
7th Pyongyang Int'l Science and Technology Book Fair Closes
Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- The 7th Pyongyang Int'l Science and Technology Book Fair opened on Sept. 13 was closed with due ceremony at the Pyongyang Centre for Cultural Exchange with Foreign Countries on Wednesday.
					 Present there were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who doubles as chairperson of the organizing committee of the fair, and others. 
					
					 Also present were delegations and delegates of various countries and international organizations and a delegation of overseas compatriots and staff members of foreign embassies here.
					
					 Certificates were awarded to organizations that presented books and materials to the fair and souvenirs handed to them.
					
					A letter to General Secretary Kim Jong Il from the participants in the fair was adopted at the closing ceremony.
					
					 Kim Jong Suk made a closing address.
					
					 During the exhibition, the delegations and delegates exchanged successes and experience gained in the fields of science, technology and media and discussed to conduct brisk exchange of publications among countries.

articles.title: Letter from Participants in Book Exhibition
articles.content:
Letter from Participants in Book Exhibition
Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a letter by the participants in the 7th Pyongyang Int'l Science and Technology Book Fair on Wednesday.
					 The letter referred to the fact that the fair was successfully held under the keen interest of media, education and scientific institutions of the DPRK and other countries and according to its basic purpose.
					
					 Saying that the participants discussed the issues of boosting the exchange and cooperation in the fields of science and technology and swapped the successes and experience gained in the fields, it expressed wholehearted thanks to Kim Jong Il for paying deep attention to the successful holding of the event.
					
					 Noting that they came to know well about the great importance the government of the DPRK has attached to the science and technology, witnessing the leaping progress made by it, the letter noted that they were deeply impressed to see the creative endeavors of the Korean people to push back the frontiers of latest science and technology.
					
					 It expressed belief that the Korean people would perform new miracles this significant year marking the 65th anniversary of foundation of the Workers' Party of Korea and build an economic power in the near future. The letter reiterated the participants' will to conduct brisk activities for scientific and technological exchange and cooperation through the fair in the future, too.
					
					 It sincerely wished Kim Jong Il good health and greater success in his noble work for the prosperity of the country and the well-being of his people.

articles.title: 2nd Forum of DPRK-China University Presidents
articles.content:
2nd Forum of DPRK-China University Presidents
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- The Second Forum of the DPRK-China University Presidents was held here on Tuesday.
					 Attending it were Jon Kuk Man, vice-chairman of the Education Commission of the DPRK, Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association, university officials including presidents of Kim Il Sung University, Kim Hyong Jik University of Education, Kim Chaek University of Technology, Pyongyang University of Mechanical Engineering, Pyongyang University of Construction and Building-Materials Industry, University of Science, Pyongyang Jang Chol Gu University of Commerce, Pyongyang University of Foreign Studies, Pyongyang University of Computer Science, Pyongyang Kim Won Gyun Conservatory and Pyongyang University of Railways and officials concerned. 
					
					 Also present were a delegation of the Ministry of Education of China headed by Xu Yongji, vice-director of the Agency for International Cooperation and Exchanges, a delegation of Chinese universities headed by Zhantao, president of Jilin University, which consists of officials of Tsinghua University, Zhongshan University, Harbin Engineering University, Liaoning University, Fuduan University, Tianjin University, Nankai University, Dalian Science and Engineering University, Dongbei University, Dongbei Normal University and Yangzhou University, a delegation of conservatories of China, a delegation of the Local Association for International Friendly Contact of China which groups officials of associations for international friendly contact in different provinces and cities of China, and Charge d'Affaires ad Interim Hao Xiaofei and staff members of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 Congratulatory addresses were made at the forum by Jon Yong Jin and Xu Yongji. 
					
					 Kim Il Gwang, vice-president of Kim Il Sung University, made a report there, which was followed by speeches of a vice-president of Kim Chaek University of Technology and the presidents of University of Science and Pyongyang University of Mechanical Engineering. 
					
					 The speakers hoped that the Chinese people would achieve greater success in building harmonious socialist society based on the scientific outlook on development under the leadership of the Communist Party of China with Hu Jintao as its general secretary.
					
					 They said that they would develop exchanges and cooperative relations with many universities of China and thus contribute to consolidating the DPRK-China relations of friendship.
					
					 Speeches were also made by a vice-president of Tsinghua University, the president of Liaoning University, a vice-president of Harbin Engineering University, the managing vice-president of Fuduan University and the president of Jilin University.
					
					They said that during their visit they were deeply moved to see the Korean people accelerating the drive to build a thriving nation through self-reliance and fortitude, closely rallied around General Secretary Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: 8th National Sirum Tournament for Grand Bull Prize Held
articles.content:
8th National Sirum Tournament for Grand Bull Prize Held
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- The 8th National Ssirum (Korean wrestling) Tournament for Grand Bull Prize was held at the wrestling site on Rungna Islet between Sept. 13 and 15. 
					 The tournament, which brought together more than 100 ace grapplers selected from Pyongyang and each province, took place in league and knockout matches, divided into body-weight and catch-weight category events.
					
					 In the body-weight category event, North Phyongan Province came first.
					
					 More than 20 grapplers matched in the catch-weight category event in which Ri Jo Won of North Phyongan Province lifted the trophy.
					
					 The closing ceremony awarded the grand bull weighing nearly one ton, a gold bell and diploma to Ri Jo Won and diplomas and medals to teams and wrestlers who proved successful.

articles.title: Pyongyang Takes On Fascinating Night View
articles.content:
Pyongyang Takes On Fascinating Night View
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang streets are bedecked with new light decorations.
					 The rhythmic and formative decorations add to the beauty of large buildings and streets in the capital.
					
					 Kim Il Sung Square is brightly illuminated by large-sized floodlights and floor lights and the Tower of Juche Idea, Korean Art Gallery, Korean Central History Museum and their surrounding buildings are adorned with LED and other electric lights in a harmonious way.
					
					 The Chollima Street presents a fantastic view with roadside trees instarred with interconnected small lamps and the Chongnyu Restaurant, Pyongyang Indoor Stadium, Changgwang Health Complex, Ice Rink and other large buildings decorated with various shapes of lights.
					
					 May Day Stadium, Rungna Bridge, Taedong Bridge, Yanggakdo International Hotel and other structures in the city are all redecorated with lights in a peculiar way.
					
					 The fantastic night view of Pyongyang gives citizens delight, as well as hope for a bright future.

articles.title: Chonghyol Enzyme Capsule Developed
articles.content:
Chonghyol Enzyme Capsule Developed
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Chonghyol Enzyme Capsule has been developed in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea to attract public attention for its great efficacy.
					 It, containing a large amount of anti-aging substances and such vitamins as B1, B2, C and E, helps remove cholesterol and neutral fat from blood vessels and purify blood. 
					
					 It is good for prevention and treatment of hypertension, cerebral thrombosis, arteriosclerosis, hepatitis, helminthiasis and other diseases, as it has a high antioxidant function and promotes the insulin secretion.
					
					 The 45-year-old developer of the capsule, Kim Chol Song, told KCNA that the clinical tests of the medicine proved its efficacy was as high as 95 percent and that those above the age of 40 would be well advised to take it on a regular basis to be in good state of health.

articles.title: Jo Yong Chol, World Shooting Champion
articles.content:
Jo Yong Chol, World Shooting Champion
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Jo Yong Chol, 23, is a world shooting champion belonging to the April 25 Defence Sports Team.
					 He bagged a gold medal at the adults' individual 10m running target event in the 50th world shooting championships held in Munich, Germany from July 29 to August 11.
					
					 He was considered to be an up-and-coming marksman when he grabbed two gold medals at the youth's individual and team 50m running target event in the 49th world shooting championships held in Croatia in Juche 95 (2006).
					
					 His coach Ri Sung Il, 52, told KCNA that his forte was taking fast and good aim.
					
					 A year after he began to learn shooting, he was already matchable to adult players.

articles.title: Papers on Contributions of Kim Il Sung to Chinese People's Revolutionary
articles.content:
Papers on Contributions of Kim Il Sung to Chinese People's Revolutionary
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Leading papers Wednesday  carry articles dealing with the contributions made by President Kim Il Sung to the revolutionary struggle of the Chinese people on the occasion of the 65th  anniversary of the publication of  his work "Let Us Actively Support the Chinese People in Their Revolutionary Struggle."
					 Recalling that the President rendered unreserved assistance to the Chinese people to help them win victory in their revolution after the country's liberation in the wake of his 20-year-long anti-Japanese revolution, papers note that this noble sense of international obligation turned the friendship between the two countries into special and unbreakable one. 
					
					 The President, who had underscored the need to  strengthen revolutionary unity of the Korean and Chinese peoples on several occasions, made public his talk "Let Us Actively Support the Chinese People in Their Revolutionary Struggle," clarifying his revolutionary stand to support the Chinese revolution at the cost of blood.
					
					 According to his crucial measure, many fine military and political cadres and members of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army (KPRA) were dispatched to new battle areas in Northeast China.
					
					 Revolutionaries and armed units of Korea eliminated remnants of the Japanese imperialists and puppet Manchukuo army, wealthy landowners, rebels and lackeys not only in the area of Yanbian but in Southern and Northern Manchuria and areas near Jilin, thereby frustrating the attempt of the Chiang Kai-shek clique to "egg counter-revolutionary forces on to rise in a rebellion and join the Kuomintang army" and creating favorable conditions for the liberation of Northeast China.
					
					 He made sure that Korea performed the role of a solid state rear for the war for the liberation of Northeast China and the victory of the Chinese revolution.
					
					 Strategic materials were transported from Korea and many units and personnel were sent to battle areas in Northeast China via areas of Korea. 
					
					 He solved all the problems raised by Chinese representatives on the spot during their visit to Korea and provided lots of war supplies including various types of weapons, ammunition, explosives, medicines, materials for military uniforms and shoes on several occasions. He clearly indicated the way of winning a victory by giving strategic and tactical advices and expressing valuable views in each important period of the war for the liberation of Northeast China. 
					
					 Hundreds of thousands of young Koreans displayed matchless heroism and self-sacrificing spirit in battlefields in Northeast China including Siping, Jilin, and Shenyang, performing signal feats.
					
					 The DPRK-China friendship forged with the comradely sense of obligation and fraternity grew stronger through the Chinese people's movement for resisting America and aiding Korea. 
					
					 The traditional friendly relations provided by the President together with the leaders of the elder generation of China are steadily growing stronger in the new century, conclude papers.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers' Ridiculous Farce Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers' Ridiculous Farce Slammed
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- The south Korean bellicose forces recently announced that they would stage the event of reenacting the "Inchon landing operation" in the waters off Wolmi Island, the largest in six decades.
					 Minju Joson Wednesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 The above-said event is nothing but a farce of the pro-U.S. sycophants and lackeys as it is aimed to whitewash the U.S. imperialists' history of war of aggression.
					
					 The "Inchon landing operation" was a total failure from a military point of view. But the south Korean puppet forces are going to stage the above-said charade, describing it as the Normandy landing operation. They have gone the lengths of doing so not simply because of their lack of knowledge.
					
					 Lurking behind this is a sinister aim sought by the group of traitors to please their American master and stoke the consciousness of confrontation with fellow countrymen among people.
					
					 The recent measures taken by the DPRK side for national reconciliation and unity are evoking lively response among south Koreans. However, the ultra-right conservative forces in south Korea are speaking ill of them, casting doubt about the "north's sincerity" and attributing them to "its internal situation." The above-said event projected by them against this backdrop cannot be construed otherwise than part of the despicable moves to escalate confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					 What the group of traitors is seeking is not national reconciliation and unity but to do harm to the compatriots at any cost.
					
					 The group would be well advised to halt such acts of treachery as sycophancy towards the U.S. and the escalation of confrontation with fellow countrymen, bearing in mind that the army and people of the DPRK are closely watching its behavior.

articles.title: Japan's Evermore Undisguised Moves for Militarization under Fire
articles.content:
Japan's Evermore Undisguised Moves for Militarization under Fire
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- The Japanese military is mulling reorganizing some of the Ground "Self-Defence Force" into an "amphibious unit" modeled on the U.S. Marines.
					  Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is not a matter to be overlooked as it is part of the evermore undisguised moves to militarize Japan.
					
					 Being a war criminal state, Japan is banned by the post-war law from possessing any combat forces.
					
					  The Japanese reactionaries claim that the purpose of the above-said reorganization is "to bolster up the capability to defend far-flung islet", but, their real intention is to enable the Ground "Self-Defence Force" to kick off its overseas aggression like the U.S. Marines. As far as the U.S. Marines are concerned, their main mission is not defense but offence. They play the role of a shock brigade in the U.S. imperialists' war of aggression and military intervention.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries, hell-bent on overseas expansion and the moves to stage a comeback to Korea, are now busy staging joint military maneuvers against the DPRK and its neighboring countries in collusion with the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 The moves to reorganize the Ground SDF into the U.S. Marines and ceaseless joint military exercises are solely aimed at attaining its sinister purposes after getting Japan involved in wars in pursuance of the U.S. imperialists' policy of aggression.
					
					 However, it is a foolish dream for the Japanese reactionaries to make desperate efforts to realize its old dream of the "Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere" backed by the U.S. 
					
					 Japan's moves to become a military giant and launch overseas aggression will only bring death and destruction to it.

articles.title: US Warmonger's Reckless Remarks Flayed in S. Korea
articles.content:
US Warmonger's Reckless Remarks Flayed in S. Korea
Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea at a press conference on Sept. 10 denounced a U.S. warmonger's outbursts escalating the military confrontation.
					 He accused the commander of the south Korea-U.S. Combined Forces Command of blustering on Sept. 9 that the Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises of the U.S. and the south Korean puppet authorities were "exercises for stabilizing the north".
					
					 His disclosure of the above-said fact which amounts to a military secret brought to light the U.S. sinister intention to escalate the military tension on the Korean Peninsula and persistently pursue confrontation with the north, he held.
					
					 What merits more serious attention is that this warmonger compared the present reality on the peninsula with what is taking place in Iraq and Afghanistan, he noted, terming this a reckless attempt to stifle the north by force of arms.
					
					 It is the unanimous desire of the people to defuse the tension on the peninsula and achieve reconciliation, cooperation and peaceful reunification between the south and the north, he said, adding that going against this trend is obviously anti-reunification act and an act of aggression.
					
					 There is no ground whatsoever for the U.S. forces to stay in this land, he declared, urging the Lee Myung Bak bellicose forces to stop toeing the U.S. policy of war.

articles.title: Madcap War Exercises Underway in S. Korea
articles.content:
Madcap War Exercises Underway in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- The 39th Division of the puppet army has been staging the 2010 Hwarang Exercises in the area of South Kyongsang Province since September 13 together with police forces and administrative organs, according to south Korean Yonhap News. 
					 At least 10,000 men including puppet army and police are involved in this saber-rattling which will reportedly go on till Sept. 17 with an aim to "establish joint defence posture and bolster up the forces for conducting operations in rear areas".
					
					 The puppet bellicose elements are busy with the moves to start a war in the Korean Peninsula at any cost under the absurd pretext of the warship case.

articles.title: Malian PM Hails Korean People's Successes
articles.content:
Malian PM Hails Korean People's Successes
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Malian Prime Minister Modibo Sidibe met the DPRK ambassador to Mali on Sept. 3.
					 The prime minister praised President Kim Il Sung as the great leader always remembered by the world people.
					
					The prime minister said that Mali congratulates the DPRK on having protected its country's sovereignty from the imperialists' moves to stifle it and registered great successes in different fields of the national economy including the metal and machine-building industries by channeling efforts into economic construction thanks to the Songun politics of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Dioncounda Traore, chairman of the National Executive Committee of the African Party for the Solidarity and Justice of Mali, received the ambassador on the same day.
					
					  He said he was pleased that Kim Jong Il has not only victoriously led party, state and army affairs full of energy but conducted positive external activities, increasing the influence of socialism worldwide.
					
					  He noted that his party is proud of maintaining deep relations with the Workers' Party of Korea invariably pursuing socialism and that he would boost the ties between the two parties in the days ahead, too.

articles.title: Bangladesh and Russian Figures Visit DPRK Embassies
articles.content:
Bangladesh and Russian Figures Visit DPRK Embassies
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Khaleq Zaman Bhuiyan, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Socialist Party of Bangladesh, Garib Newaz, president of the Bangladesh People's League, Ragib Ahsan Munna, secretary general of the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee, Elena Scherbakova, director of the State Academic Igor Moiseyev Dance Company of Russia, and leading members of the dance company visited the DPRK embassies in their countries on Sept. 7 and 9 on the occasion of the 62nd anniversary of the DPRK.
					 They laid baskets and bunches of flowers before the full-length paintings of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Russia
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- The Vladivostok Vita Publishing House of Russia brought out in booklet leader Kim Jong Il's work "The Workers' Party of Korea Is the Party of the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung" on Sept. 10.
					 The work, published on October 2, Juche 84 (1995), reviews with pride the glorious history of the Workers' Party of Korea which blazed a new path for building a revolutionary party in the era of independence under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung. It serves as an immortal great programme for party building and activities as it indicated the way for developing the WPK into an eternal party of the President.

articles.title: Birthday of DPRK Celebrated in Cuba
articles.content:
Birthday of DPRK Celebrated in Cuba
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held in Havana on Sept. 8 to celebrate the 62nd birthday of the DPRK and the 50th anniversary of the DPRK-Cuba diplomatic relations.
					 On display in its venue were photos showing the signal successes gained by the servicepersons and people of the DPRK in building a great prosperous and powerful nation.
					
					 Attending it were Ramon Ripol, vice-minister of Trade and Foreign Investment, officials of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Communist Party and the Institute for Asia and Oceania of Cuba and popular masses.
					
					 Present on invitation were Ambassador Kwon Sung Chol and staff members of the DPRK embassy and diplomatic envoys of different countries in Cuba.
					
					 Speakers at the meeting warmly congratulated the Korean people on the 62nd anniversary of the DPRK and wished for successful holding of the conference of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Saying that the meeting between President Kim Il Sung and Fidel Castro Ruz in 1986 was an event of weighty significance in the development of the relations between the two countries, they expressed belief that the bilateral relations of friendship would further develop under the leadership of Kim Jong Il and Fidel Castro Ruz and Raul Castro Ruz.
					
					 Over the past 50 years after the establishment of diplomatic relations Cuba and the DPRK have developed the sincere relationship of friendship and cooperation, they said, recalling that the two countries have supported and solidarized with each other in the international arena. And they stressed that the Cuban people hope the fraternal Korean people would certainly realize the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.

articles.title: Birthday of DPRK Observed
articles.content:
Birthday of DPRK Observed 
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- A joint meeting of the organizations for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian regions was held in Sankt-Peterburg in Russia on Sept. 9 on the occasion of the 62nd anniversary of the birthday of the DPRK.
					 Reports and speeches were made at the meeting. 
					
					 The general secretary of the International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions said in his report that the DPRK founded on Sept. 9, 1948 is a state of new type unprecedented in the history of mankind.
					
					 The DPRK is an original man-centered socialist state in which the people are the masters of everything and everything serves them, he said.
					
					Noting that the DPRK always shines as Kim Il Sung's Korea, he stressed that it would be unthinkable without General Secretary Kim Jong Il who has carried forward the idea and cause of President Kim Il Sung, he referred to the fact that he has pursued the Songun politics, smashing the ultra anti-socialist moves of the U.S. imperialists with its might.
					
					 The speakers informed the attendants of the study and dissemination of the Juche idea and Songun idea at their units and stressed the need to apply the Songun idea to the present reality and resolutely smash all the challenges and moves of the imperialist forces.
					
					 A message of greetings to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Birthday of DPRK Marked
articles.content:
Birthday of DPRK Marked 
Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held in Bangladesh and lectures and film shows in Russia, Indonesia, Malaysia and India between September 2 and 5 to celebrate the 62nd anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Appreciated at the film shows were such Korean films as "The Tower of the Juche Idea" and "Pyongyang at Night".
					
					 Speeches were made at the events.
					
					 The president of the Bangladesh People's League and other speakers noted that President Kim Il Sung achieved the historic cause of national liberation and then founded the DPRK and wisely led it, thus building in Korea a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence.
					
					His unique idea on state building and exploits have been creditably carried forward by General Secretary Kim Jong Il, they said, adding that the DPRK is demonstrating its might as a politico-ideological and military power under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A vice-president of an Indonesian university said that the DPRK has turned into a genuine people's country the world progressives had idealized. The credit for all these successes goes to the wise leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, he stressed.

articles.title: Perdidas causadas por el tifon No.7
articles.content:
Perdidas causadas por el tifon No.7
Pyongyang, 15 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Debido a los efectos del tifon No.7 que surgio a principios de septiembre, toda la extension de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ha sido perjudicada seriamente.
					  Segun los datos recogidos, decenas de personas a lo largo del pais murieron a causa de la lluvia torrencial, la tormenta, el derrumbe de la montana, etc.
					
					  Fueron destruidos mas de 3 mil 300 edificios para mas de 8 mil 380 familias y numerosos habitantes perdieron sus bienes familiares y viven en las residencias improvisadas.
					
					  En la rama agricola, resultaron inundadas, rellenadas y desaparecidas mas de 30 mil 550 hectareas del terreno cultivable.
					
					  Tambien fueron destruidos mas de 230 edificios publicos y de produccion y averiadas las carreteras en mas de 170 tramos.
					
					  Por otra parte, se destruyo completamente el terraplen de una dimension de 6 mil 200 metros cuadrados en el tramo ferroviario de 250 metros y 65 mil 980 metros del ferrocarril fueron averiados por el derrumbe de la montana.
					
					  Ademas, en algunas zonas se cortaron las lineas de transmision electrica en muchos tramos y se destruyeron los depositos de agua potable y redes de acueductos.
					
					  El corte de suministros de electricidad y agua potable y el bloqueo del trafico a causa de desastres naturales obstaculizan enviar a tiempo los alimentos y los medicamentos necesarios para estabilizar la vida de los damnificados.

articles.title: Norodom Sihanouk dona dinero a los damnificados coreanos
articles.content:
Norodom Sihanouk dona dinero a los damnificados coreanos
Pyongyang, 15 de septiembre (ATCC) -- El gran rey de Cambodia, Norodom Sihanouk, envio el dinero de consuelo en relacion con que recientemente la ciudad de Sinuiju de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte y otras zonas de Corea sufrieron grandes perdidas materiales debido a las inundaciones.
					  Por encargo del gran rey, el vicepremier encargado del Palacio Real de Cambodia, Kong Sam Ol, lo entrego el dia 11 al embajador coreano en ese pais, Ri In Sok.
					
					  Kong Sam Ol expreso condolencias al gobierno y el pueblo hermano de Corea a nombre del rey, el gran rey y la gran reina y transmitio el deseo del gran rey camboyano de que el dinero de consuelo contribuya, aunque fuera un poco, a la lucha del pueblo coreano por reparar cuanto antes las secuelas de inundaciones y acelerar la construccion de una gran potencia prospera.

articles.title: Periodicos elogian internacionalismo de Kim Il Sung por revolucion china
articles.content:
Periodicos elogian internacionalismo de Kim Il Sung por revolucion china
						
Pyongyang, 15 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Los periodicos capitalinos publicaron hoy los articulos que elogian las hazanas del Presidente Kim Il Sung, quien contribuyo a la lucha revolucionaria del pueblo chino, con motivo del 65o aniversario de la publicacion de su obra "Apoyemos activamente la lucha revolucionaria del pueblo chino".
					Despues de liberar la patria al cabo de 20 anos de la revolucion antijaponesa, el Presidente brindo sincera ayuda por el triunfo de la revolucion china. Su noble internacionalismo convirtio la amistad Corea-China en las relaciones especiales, solidas e inseparables, comienzan los periodicos y continuan:
					
					  Destaco en varias ocasiones la necesidad de fortalecer la unidad revolucionaria con el pueblo chino y publico la historica declaracion "Apoyemos activamente la lucha revolucionaria del pueblo chino" exponiendo solemnemente la posicion revolucionaria de ayudar con sangre la revolucion china.
					
					Segun la medida decisiva tomada por el Presidente para apoyar la lucha revolucionaria del pueblo chino, los sobresalientes cuadros militares y politicos y miembros del Ejercito Revolucionario Popular de Corea (ERPC) fueron enviados en masas a los nuevos teatros de combate de la region nordeste de China.
					
					Al aniquilar en la region de Yanbian, Nanman, Beiman y las periferias de Jilin a los desbandados de las derrotadas tropas japonesas y del Estado titere de Manchuria, los  terratenientes, los bandoleros y los lacayos, los revolucionarios y las unidades armadas de Corea dieron las condiciones favorables para la liberacion de la region nordeste de China frustrando el intento de la camarilla de Chang Kai-shek.
					
					El Presidente hizo que Corea cumpliera el papel de solida retaguardia estatal por la victoria de la guerra de liberacion de la citada region nordeste y la revolucion china.
					
					Por via de Corea, fueron transportados los materiales militares y enviadas numerosas unidades y personas a los lugares de combate del nordeste chino.
					
					El Presidente resolvio de inmediato todo lo que pedian los delegados chinos y ayudo en varias ocasiones los fusiles de distintos generos, municiones, polvoras, medicamentos, telas de uniforme militar y calzados.
					
					En cada periodo dificil de la guerra de liberacion del nordeste chino, el Presidente dio consejos estrategicos y tacticos iluminando la via a la victoria.
					
					Cientos de miles de jovenes coreanos realizaron grandes meritos militares usando su heroismo y espiritu de sacrificio en los escenarios de combate como Siping, Jilin, Shenyang y otros lugares del nordeste.
					
					La amistad Corea-China basada en la camaraderia y fraternidad se hizo mas solida con la participacion del pueblo chino en la guerra coreana para rechazar la invasion de los imperialistas norteamericanos.
					
					Las tradicionales relaciones de amistad preparadas por el Presidente Kim Il Sung junto con los dirigentes chinos de la veterana generacion se desarrollan mas de generacion en generacion en el nuevo siglo.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia la militarizacion de Japon
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia la militarizacion de Japon
Pyongyang, 15 de septiembre (ATCC) -- El circulo militar japones intenta reorganizar una parte de las "Fuerzas Terrestres de Autodefensa" como la "unidad anfibia" imitando a la infanteria de marina de EE.UU.
					Este problema resulta insoslayable porque forma parte de las cada dia mas abiertas maniobras para la militarizacion de Japon.
					
					Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual difundido este miercoles y continua:
					
					Esta prohibido por la ley que Japon, pais criminal de guerra, posea las fuerzas armadas de combate de cualquier tipo despues de la Segunda Guerra Mundial.
					
					Si bien los reaccionarios japoneses hablan tanto de que el proposito de la reorganizacion de sus "Fuerzas Terrestres de Autodefensa" al estilo de la infanteria de marina de EE.UU. es "fortalecer la defensa de las islas apartadas", la verdadera meta esta en emprender el camino de agresion a ultramar como esas fuerzas yanquis.
					
					El ataque es la mision principal de la infanteria de marina de EE.UU. Estas fuerzas cumplieron el papel de la brigada de choque en la guerra de agresion y la intervencion militar de EE.UU.
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses, que estan locos por la expansion al extranjero y la reagresion a Corea, libran a menudo los ejercicios militares conjuntos contra la RPDC y otros paises vecinos en contubernio con el imperialismo yanqui.
					
					Los susodichos movimientos de ellos no tienen otra meta que lanzarse a la guerra sumandose a la politica agresiva del imperialismo norteamericano.
					
					Pero, estan muy equivocados los reaccionarios japoneses que intentan realizar su sueno antiguo de la "Esfera de coprosperidad de gran Asia Oriental" bajo el amparo de EE.UU. La muerte y la ruina son lo que sufrira Japon si sigue actuando para convertirse en una potencia militar y agredir a ultramar.

articles.title: Clausurada VII exposicion internacional de libros de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Clausurada VII exposicion internacional de libros de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 15 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Quedo clausurada este miercoles en el Centro de Intercambio Cultural con el Extranjero de Pyongyang la VII Exposicion Internacional de Libros Cientifico-Tecnicos de Pyongyang inaugurada el dia 13.
					En la ceremonia de clausura estuvieron presentes el secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Choe Thae Bok, la presidenta del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero y del comite organizador del evento, Kim Jong Suk, y otros funcionarios.
					
					Ademas, participaron las delegaciones y los delegados de varios paises, organizaciones internacionales y de los coreanos en ultramar y los miembros de las embajadas de varios paises acreditados en Corea.
					
					Fueron otorgados los diplomas y recuerdos a las entidades que han donado los libros y datos que habian sido exhibidos en el evento.
					
					En el acto fue aprobada la carta de los participantes dirigida al Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Kim Jong Suk pronuncio el discurso de clausura.
					
					En el periodo de la exposicion, las delegaciones y los delegados intercambiaron los exitos y experiencias logrados en los sectores cientifico-tecnicos y de prensa y acordaron librar activamente el intercambio de las publicaciones entre los paises.

articles.title: Paisaje nocturno de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Paisaje nocturno de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 15 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Recientemente, en las avenidas capitalinas se han instalado nuevos aparatos de decoracion electrica que hacen mas hermosos los edificios por la noche.
					  Especialmente, la Plaza Kim Il Sung esta tan clara como de dia gracias a los reflectores de gran tamano y las lamparas de suelo mientras las LED iluminan suavemente el Monumento a la Idea Juche y los edificios perifericos.
					
					Igualmente, forman un mundo fascinante los aparatos de iluminacion de varios tipos colocados en el Museo de Bellas Artes de Corea, el Museo Nacional de la Historia de Corea y otros edificios cercanos.
					
					  Parecen una pintura las anchas vias de la avenida Chollima decoradas con las lamparas en hilera en forma de cesto de flores y el Restaurante Chongryu, el Palacio de Deportes de Pyongyang, el Complejo de Piscinas y Servicios de Cultura Fisica Changgwangwon, el Complejo de Patinaje bajo Techo, etc.
					
					  La decoracion electrica se ha hecho tambien en el Estadio Primero de Mayo, que luce como una flor flotante, los Puentes Rungra y Taedong y el Hotel Yanggakdo.
					
					  Contemplando el maravilloso paisaje nocturno de Pyongyang, los capitalinos imaginan el aspecto de la gran potencia prospera que se les aproxima.
